alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:03PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN, LIKELY HEAVY, WITH RISING SNOW LEVELS LATE WEEK... Signals continue to point to a possible atmospheric river event late this week into the weekend including warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and the potential for accumulating snow changing to heavy rain. Upper Lynn Canal will receive light to moderate snow. A winter weather advisory is posted for Haines for this evening. A short break is possible Thursday and Thursday night before heavy precipitation starts Friday morning. At sea level, the precipitation may start as a mix of snow and rain before quickly changing to all rain, heavy at times. Snow will hang on longer for the Haines and Klondike highways and at higher elevations, with heavy snow possible near the Canadian border of the Klondike highway. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible from Friday through Sunday. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 9 inches are possible out the Haines highway and up to 12 inches at White Pass with lower amounts at lower elevations. Snow levels are forecast to rise to around 2,500 feet which could lead to a melting mountain snowpack and introduce some nuisance flooding concerns. Rain over deep snow on top of structures and rooftops could challenge load limits. Please stay tuned to the forecast as it is refined through the week.

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
